pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

idioms.meaning: interference in the domestic affairs of another country

lessons.japanese: 君の事に干渉するつもりはない。
lessons.english: It is not my part to meddle in your affairs.

lessons.japanese: ボブはジェーンに自分の個人的な事を干渉しないよう言った。
lessons.english: Bob told Jane not to interfere in his personal affairs.

lessons.japanese: その国はわが国に内政干渉をした。
lessons.english: That country intervened in the internal affairs of our nation.

lessons.japanese: いかなる国も他国の内政に干渉してはならない。
lessons.english: No country should interfere in another country's internal affairs.

lessons.japanese: あなたは他人のことに干渉する権利はありません。
lessons.english: You have no right to interfere in other people's affairs.

lessons.japanese: 僕のことに干渉しないでくれ。
母はいつも私の私的な生活に干渉してばかりいる。
lessons.english: My mother is always poking her nose into my private life.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは他国の内政に干渉すべきではない。
lessons.english: They should not intervene in the internal affairs of another country.

lessons.japanese: 彼は誰にも彼の私事に干渉させなかった。
lessons.english: He wouldn't let anybody interfere with his private affairs.

lessons.japanese: 彼は私たちの家族の問題に干渉する権利はない。
lessons.english: He has no right to interfere in our family affairs.

lessons.japanese: 大国は小国に干渉すべきではない。
lessons.english: The big nations should not interfere with the smaller nations.

lessons.japanese: 大国は小国に干渉すべきではない。
lessons.english: Large countries shouldn't interfere with smaller countries.

lessons.japanese: 他人の事に干渉しないほうがいいよ。
lessons.english: You shouldn't interfere in other people's business.

lessons.japanese: 他人のことに干渉するな。
lessons.english: Don't interfere in other people's affairs.
